feed.title: GitHub TypeScript Weekly Trending
feed.subtitle: Weekly Trending of TypeScript in GitHub

entry.title: sveltejs/svelte
entry.summary:
Cybernetically enhanced web apps

What is Svelte?

Svelte is a new way to build web applications. It's a compiler that takes your declarative components and converts them into efficient JavaScript that surgically updates the DOM.

Learn more at the Svelte website, or stop by the Discord chatroom.

Supporting Svelte

Svelte is an MIT-licensed open source project with its ongoing development made possible entirely by fantastic volunteers. If you'd like to support their efforts, please consider:

  • Becoming a backer on Open Collective.

Funds donated via Open Collective will be used for compensating expenses related to Svelte's development such as hosting costs. If sufficient donations are received, funds may also be used to support Svelte's development more directly.

Development

Pull requests are encouraged and always welcome. Pick an issue and help us out!

To install and work on Svelte locally:

git clone https://github.com/sveltejs/svelte.git
cd svelte
npm install

Do not use Yarn to install the dependencies, as the specific package versions in package-lock.json are used to build and test Svelte.

To build the compiler and all the other modules included in the package:

npm run build

To watch for changes and continually rebuild the package (this is useful if you're using npm link to test out changes in a project locally):

npm run dev

The compiler is written in TypeScript, but don't let that put you off ‚Äî it's basically just JavaScript with type annotations. You'll pick it up in no time. If you're using an editor other than Visual Studio Code, you may need to install a plugin in order to get syntax highlighting and code hints, etc.

Running Tests

npm run test

To filter tests, use -g (aka --grep). For example, to only run tests involving transitions:

npm run test -- -g transition

svelte.dev

The source code for https://svelte.dev, including all the documentation, lives in the site directory. The site is built with SvelteKit.

Is svelte.dev down?

Probably not, but it's possible. If you can't seem to access any .dev sites, check out this SuperUser question and answer.

License

MIT

entry.title: streamich/react-use
entry.summary:
React Hooks ‚Äî üëç



üëç
react-use






Collection of essential React Hooks. Port of libreact.
Translations: üá®üá≥ Ê±âËØ≠ 



npm i react-use





  • Sensors
    • useBattery ‚Äî tracks device battery state.
    • useGeolocation ‚Äî tracks geo location state of user's device.
    • useHover and useHoverDirty ‚Äî tracks mouse hover state of some element.
    • useHash ‚Äî tracks location hash value.
    • useIdle ‚Äî tracks whether user is being inactive.
    • useIntersection ‚Äî tracks an HTML element's intersection.
    • useKey, useKeyPress, useKeyboardJs, and useKeyPressEvent ‚Äî track keys.
    • useLocation and useSearchParam ‚Äî tracks page navigation bar location state.
    • useLongPress ‚Äî tracks long press gesture of some element.
    • useMedia ‚Äî tracks state of a CSS media query.
    • useMediaDevices ‚Äî tracks state of connected hardware devices.
    • useMotion ‚Äî tracks state of device's motion sensor.
    • useMouse and useMouseHovered ‚Äî tracks state of mouse position.
    • useMouseWheel ‚Äî tracks deltaY of scrolled mouse wheel.
    • useNetworkState ‚Äî tracks the state of browser's network connection.
    • useOrientation ‚Äî tracks state of device's screen orientation.
    • usePageLeave ‚Äî triggers when mouse leaves page boundaries.
    • useScratch ‚Äî tracks mouse click-and-scrub state.
    • useScroll ‚Äî tracks an HTML element's scroll position.
    • useScrolling ‚Äî tracks whether HTML element is scrolling.
    • useStartTyping ‚Äî detects when user starts typing.
    • useWindowScroll ‚Äî tracks Window scroll position.
    • useWindowSize ‚Äî tracks Window dimensions.
    • useMeasure and useSize ‚Äî tracks an HTML element's dimensions.
    • createBreakpoint ‚Äî tracks innerWidth
    • useScrollbarWidth ‚Äî detects browser's native scrollbars width.
    • usePinchZoom ‚Äî tracks pointer events to detect pinch zoom in and out status.

  • UI
    • useAudio ‚Äî plays audio and exposes its controls.
    • useClickAway ‚Äî triggers callback when user clicks outside target area.
    • useCss ‚Äî dynamically adjusts CSS.
    • useDrop and useDropArea ‚Äî tracks file, link and copy-paste drops.
    • useFullscreen ‚Äî display an element or video full-screen.
    • useSlider ‚Äî provides slide behavior over any HTML element.
    • useSpeech ‚Äî synthesizes speech from a text string.
    • useVibrate ‚Äî provide physical feedback using the Vibration API.
    • useVideo ‚Äî plays video, tracks its state, and exposes playback controls.

  • Animations
    • useRaf ‚Äî re-renders component on each requestAnimationFrame.
    • useInterval and useHarmonicIntervalFn ‚Äî re-renders component on a set interval using setInterval.
    • useSpring ‚Äî interpolates number over time according to spring dynamics.
    • useTimeout ‚Äî re-renders component after a timeout.
    • useTimeoutFn ‚Äî calls given function after a timeout.
    • useTween ‚Äî re-renders component, while tweening a number from 0 to 1.
    • useUpdate ‚Äî returns a callback, which re-renders component when called.

  • Side-effects
    • useAsync, useAsyncFn, and useAsyncRetry ‚Äî resolves an async function.
    • useBeforeUnload ‚Äî shows browser alert when user try to reload or close the page.
    • useCookie ‚Äî provides way to read, update and delete a cookie.
    • useCopyToClipboard ‚Äî copies text to clipboard.
    • useDebounce ‚Äî debounces a function.
    • useError ‚Äî error dispatcher.
    • useFavicon ‚Äî sets favicon of the page.
    • useLocalStorage ‚Äî manages a value in localStorage.
    • useLockBodyScroll ‚Äî lock scrolling of the body element.
    • useRafLoop ‚Äî calls given function inside the RAF loop.
    • useSessionStorage ‚Äî manages a value in sessionStorage.
    • useThrottle and useThrottleFn ‚Äî throttles a function.
    • useTitle ‚Äî sets title of the page.
    • usePermission ‚Äî query permission status for browser APIs.

  • Lifecycles
    • useEffectOnce ‚Äî a modified useEffect hook that only runs once.
    • useEvent ‚Äî subscribe to events.
    • useLifecycles ‚Äî calls mount and unmount callbacks.
    • useMountedState and useUnmountPromise ‚Äî track if component is mounted.
    • usePromise ‚Äî resolves promise only while component is mounted.
    • useLogger ‚Äî logs in console as component goes through life-cycles.
    • useMount ‚Äî calls mount callbacks.
    • useUnmount ‚Äî calls unmount callbacks.
    • useUpdateEffect ‚Äî run an effect only on updates.
    • useIsomorphicLayoutEffect ‚Äî useLayoutEffect that that works on server.
    • useDeepCompareEffect, useShallowCompareEffect, and useCustomCompareEffect

  • State
    • createMemo ‚Äî factory of memoized hooks.
    • createReducer ‚Äî factory of reducer hooks with custom middleware.
    • createReducerContext and createStateContext ‚Äî factory of hooks for a sharing state between components.
    • useDefault ‚Äî returns the default value when state is null or undefined.
    • useGetSet ‚Äî returns state getter get() instead of raw state.
    • useGetSetState ‚Äî as if useGetSet and useSetState had a baby.
    • useLatest ‚Äî returns the latest state or props
    • usePrevious ‚Äî returns the previous state or props.
    • usePreviousDistinct ‚Äî like usePrevious but with a predicate to determine if previous should update.
    • useObservable ‚Äî tracks latest value of an Observable.
    • useRafState ‚Äî creates setState method which only updates after requestAnimationFrame.
    • useSetState ‚Äî creates setState method which works like this.setState.
    • useStateList ‚Äî circularly iterates over an array.
    • useToggle and useBoolean ‚Äî tracks state of a boolean.
    • useCounter and useNumber ‚Äî tracks state of a number.
    • useList and useUpsert ‚Äî tracks state of an array.
    • useMap ‚Äî tracks state of an object.
    • useSet ‚Äî tracks state of a Set.
    • useQueue ‚Äî implements simple queue.
    • useStateValidator ‚Äî tracks state of an object.
    • useStateWithHistory ‚Äî stores previous state values and provides handles to travel through them.
    • useMultiStateValidator ‚Äî alike the useStateValidator, but tracks multiple states at a time.
    • useMediatedState ‚Äî like the regular useState but with mediation by custom function.
    • useFirstMountState ‚Äî check if current render is first.
    • useRendersCount ‚Äî count component renders.
    • createGlobalState ‚Äî cross component shared state.
    • useMethods ‚Äî neat alternative to useReducer.

  • Miscellaneous
    • useEnsuredForwardedRef and ensuredForwardRef ‚Äî use a React.forwardedRef safely.







Usage ‚Äî how to import.
Unlicense ‚Äî public domain.
Support ‚Äî add yourself to backer list below.






Contributors

entry.title: grafana/grafana
entry.summary:
The open and composable observability and data visualization platform. Visualize metrics, logs, and traces from multiple sources like Prometheus, Loki, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, Postgres and many more.

The open-source platform for monitoring and observability

Grafana allows you to query, visualize, alert on and understand your metrics no matter where they are stored. Create, explore, and share dashboards with your team and foster a data-driven culture:

  • Visualizations: Fast and flexible client side graphs with a multitude of options. Panel plugins offer many different ways to visualize metrics and logs.
  • Dynamic Dashboards: Create dynamic & reusable dashboards with template variables that appear as dropdowns at the top of the dashboard.
  • Explore Metrics: Explore your data through ad-hoc queries and dynamic drilldown. Split view and compare different time ranges, queries and data sources side by side.
  • Explore Logs: Experience the magic of switching from metrics to logs with preserved label filters. Quickly search through all your logs or streaming them live.
  • Alerting: Visually define alert rules for your most important metrics. Grafana will continuously evaluate and send notifications to systems like Slack, PagerDuty, VictorOps, OpsGenie.
  • Mixed Data Sources: Mix different data sources in the same graph! You can specify a data source on a per-query basis. This works for even custom datasources.

Get started

  • Get Grafana
  • Installation guides

Unsure if Grafana is for you? Watch Grafana in action on play.grafana.org!

Documentation

The Grafana documentation is available at grafana.com/docs.

Contributing

If you're interested in contributing to the Grafana project:

  • Start by reading the Contributing guide.
  • Learn how to set up your local environment, in our Developer guide.
  • Explore our beginner-friendly issues.
  • Look through our style guide and Storybook.

Get involved

  • Follow @grafana on Twitter.
  • Read and subscribe to the Grafana blog.
  • If you have a specific question, check out our discussion forums.
  • For general discussions, join us on the official Slack team.

License

Grafana is distributed under AGPL-3.0-only. For Apache-2.0 exceptions, see LICENSING.md.
